Description.val:
Increment 3.2B retrofits Block 30 and 35 aircraft with hardware to host Increment 3.2B capabilities including the Enhanced Stores Management System (ESMS) Common Split Bus, AIM-120D, AIM-9X, Electronic Protection enhancements, Intra-Flight Datalink (IFDL) improvements, and Geolocate 2.0.  Increment 3.2B is the user's highest priority for F-22.

F-22 Increment 3.2B procurement and installation is scheduled to complete prior to FY 2023 therefore there is no cost to complete.

Funding for this exhibit is contained in PE 0207138F. 

The RDT&E funding for this effort is contained in PE 0207138F (FY 2004 - FY 2018; PE 0207163F (FY 2010 - FY 2013); PE 0207445F (FY 2007 - FY 2010); and PE 020001F (FY 2007).

Justification.val: Where applicable, justification for individual modifications is provided in the P-3A exhibits.

Description.val: The FY 2017 President's Budget approved Inc. 3.2B to procure long lead items required for Full Rate Production (FRP), scheduled to begin in 4th Qtr. FY 2018.

Justification.val: Advance procurement of long lead items prevents a 16 month delay to start of full rate production (FRP) kit production.

Description.val:
Increment 3.2B retrofits Block 30 and 35 aircraft with hardware to host Increment 3.2B Enhanced Stores Management System (ESMS) Common Split Bus, AIM-120D, AIM-9X, Electronic Protection enhancements, IFDL improvements, and Geolocate 2.0. Increment 3.2B is the user's highest priority for F-22.

Milestone/Development Status

All hardware is qualified and is being installed on 3.2B test aircraft.
FY 2017 Advance Procurement procures 1184 cable assemblies that are long lead items required for Full Rate (FRP) kit production scheduled to begin 3rd Qtr. FY 2018.
